column4: i just did a partial upgrade and now my wireless is gone. I don't even have the option to enable wireless. Can anyone help?
what wireless NIC do you have?
the chipset your wireless card has. i.e. the output of lspci -vvnn for your wireless
that card should work, can you pastebin the command "dmesg"?
nothing so far. what does "iwlist scan" say?
"Interface doesn't support scanning." three times for lo, eth0, pan0
weird. try "sudo modprobe wl" and pastebin dmesg again after that command
I did sudo modprobe wl and it just connected... what did that do?
it loads the driver, which should get autoloaded at boot.
try adding wl to the list of modules in /etc/modules, that should keep it loaded next boot.
it would be interesting to know, why it wasn't autoloaded now, this could cause some harm. do you happen to remember what packages were not upgraded during your partial upgrade?
